author: fradamt
content: Something we were wondering with <@415548822983278593> is whether PeerDAS should have *per validator* custody from the first iteration. Is there any reason not to? We can keep the publicly computable custody, with a value chosen to provide a backbone of long-lived subscriptions for the subnets and enough "data density" for peer sampling. What we don't need is extra public custody for the purpose of pre-sampling guarantees. Since it is only useful for voting, we can make this extra-custody be per-validator

author: fradamt
content: This also has the benefit of "social attributability" of availability failures (if something unavailable is finalized it is possible to determine whose fault it is)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<hwwang> Hi!

Based on the discussion with @jimmygchen, @nishantd, and <@520034910149410861> on DMs, I tried to break down and simplify the peerdas milestones for interop / 1st devenet
https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/peerdas-devnet-0

M1-M3 should be simple.

M4 includes a need of adding `DataColumnSidecarsByRange` to the specs. I suppose some client teams already have it from the client end?

M5, we proposed a simplified version of `is_data_available`. It would be determined by “if I can download all my custody columns”. We should talk more about it onsite, but for now, we try to focus on sampling and interoperability.

Let me know if it make sense to you or not!
